info.description: Emergent Knowledge Base API - AI-powered knowledge management system
info.title: Emergent API

get.description: Returns all agents for the current project

post.description: Creates a new agent with the specified configuration

400.description: Invalid request body or validation error

get.description: Returns an agent by ID

delete.description: Deletes an agent by ID

400.description: Invalid agent ID or request body

post.description: Batch triggers a reaction agent for multiple graph objects (max 100)

400.description: Invalid agent ID, not a reaction agent, or invalid request

get.description: Returns pending events (unprocessed graph objects) for a reaction agent
get.summary: Get pending events for reaction agent

400.description: Invalid agent ID or not a reaction agent

get.description: Returns recent runs for an agent

post.description: Cancels a running agent run

400.description: Invalid agent ID or run ID

post.description: Triggers an immediate run of an agent (manual execution)

get.description: List all MCP servers registered for the current project

post.description: Register a new MCP server for the current project

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific MCP server

delete.description: Delete an MCP server and all its tools

patch.description: Update an existing MCP server configuration

get.description: Returns metadata about the current authentication token including project/org context
Returns all chat conversations for the current project with pagination support

post.description: Creates a new chat conversation with an initial message
Streams AI chat responses using Server-Sent Events (SSE). Creates or continues a conversation with streaming token delivery.

get.description: Returns a single conversation with all its messages

delete.description: Permanently deletes a conversation and all its messages

post.description: Adds a new message to an existing conversation

get.description: Returns all integrations for the current project with optional filtering

post.description: Creates a new data source integration with encrypted configuration

get.description: Returns all available data source providers (ClickUp, IMAP, Gmail, Google Drive)
Returns the JSON schema for configuring a specific provider type
Returns document counts grouped by source type for the current project

post.description: Tests a provider configuration without creating an integration

parameters.description: Provider type and config to test
parameters.name: request

get.description: Returns a specific data source integration by ID

delete.description: Deletes a data source integration by ID

patch.description: Updates an existing integration (partial update with encrypted config)

post.description: Triggers a sync job for an integration (manual or full sync)

200.description: Sync job created or already running

get.description: Returns all sync jobs for a specific integration with optional status filter

200.description: Sync jobs list with total count

get.description: Returns the most recent sync job for an integration

200.description: Latest sync job (null if no jobs exist)

get.description: Returns a specific sync job by ID

400.description: Invalid integration ID or job ID

404.description: Integration or sync job not found

post.description: Cancels a running or pending sync job

400.description: Invalid ID or job cannot be cancelled

404.description: Integration or sync job not found

post.description: Tests the connection for an existing integration using stored config

get.description: List all documents for the project with optional filtering and pagination

parameters.description: Filter to root documents only (no parent)
parameters.name: rootOnly

post.description: Create a new document or return existing if content hash matches (deduplication)

delete.description: Delete multiple documents and all related entities by ID list

post.description: Preview the impact of bulk deleting multiple documents

get.description: Returns a list of all available document source types with counts

post.description: Upload a file and create a document record (with automatic deduplication)

get.description: Retrieve a single document by its ID

delete.description: Delete a single document and all related entities (chunks, extraction jobs, graph objects)

get.description: Retrieve the text content of a document
Preview the impact of deleting a document (counts of related entities that will be deleted)
Returns a redirect to a signed URL for downloading the original file

post.description: Deletes existing chunks for a document and regenerates them using the current chunking strategy

get.description: Returns the current number of active SSE connections to the events stream (for monitoring purposes)

Establish Server-Sent Events (SSE) connection to receive real-time entity updates for a project (documents, chunks, extraction jobs, graph objects, notifications). Connection requires projectId query parameter and sends periodic heartbeats.

200.description: SSE stream (events: connected, entity.created, entity.updated, entity.deleted, entity.batch, heartbeat)

get.description: Returns graph objects sorted by most recent access time for analytics

parameters.description: Minimum access count (not yet implemented, default: 1)
parameters.name: min_access_count

get.description: List graph objects that have not been accessed within a specified number of days
Returns all branches, optionally filtered by project

post.description: Creates a new branch for graph versioning and isolation

get.description: Retrieves a specific branch by ID

delete.description: Deletes a branch by ID

patch.description: Updates a branch's name or metadata

post.description: Merge a source branch into a target branch (supports dry-run mode)

parameters.description: Source branch ID and merge options
parameters.name: request

get.description: Returns embedding policies for a project with optional filtering by object type

post.description: Creates a new embedding policy for controlling vector embedding generation

get.description: Retrieves a specific embedding policy by ID

delete.description: Deletes an embedding policy by ID

patch.description: Updates an existing embedding policy's configuration

post.description: Perform breadth-first expansion from root nodes with depth and node limits

parameters.description: Root IDs and expansion options (max 50 roots)
parameters.name: request

200.description: Expanded graph with nodes and edges

post.description: Create a new versioned graph object with properties, labels, and metadata
Create multiple graph objects in a single request with partial success semantics
Update the status field for multiple graph objects in a single request

get.description: Returns the total count of graph objects matching the given filters, without returning the objects themselves.
Search graph objects using PostgreSQL full-text search with filters
Search and filter graph objects with pagination, type/label filtering, and relationship queries

parameters.description: Filter objects related to this ID
parameters.name: related_to_id

get.description: Retrieve all distinct labels/tags used by graph objects in a project

parameters.description: Filter to tags from objects of this type
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Filter to tags starting with this prefix
parameters.name: prefix

parameters.description: Maximum number of tags to return
parameters.name: limit

put.description: Create or update a graph object identified by its (type, key) combination. If an object with the same type and key exists, it is updated; otherwise, a new object is created.

post.description: Search graph objects using vector embeddings (768-dimensional)

get.description: Retrieve a graph object. Use resolveHead=true to get the latest version when ID refers to an older version in the version chain.

parameters.description: Return latest version if ID is old version
parameters.name: resolveHead

delete.description: Soft-delete a graph object (sets deleted_at timestamp)

patch.description: Update a graph object by creating a new version in the version chain

get.description: Retrieve all incoming and outgoing relationships for a graph object, with optional type and direction filtering.

parameters.description: Filter by direction: 'incoming', 'outgoing', or omit for both
parameters.name: direction

get.description: Retrieve all versions of a graph object ordered by creation time

post.description: Restore a soft-deleted graph object (clears deleted_at timestamp)

get.description: Find graph objects similar to a given object using vector similarity search

post.description:
Create a new relationship (edge) between two graph objects.
Automatically generates a triplet text embedding for semantic search
(e.g., "Elon Musk founded Tesla") using Vertex AI text-embedding-004.
Embedding failures are non-blocking  the relationship is created even if embedding fails.
Create multiple graph relationships in a single request with partial success semantics

get.description: Search and filter graph relationships with pagination and filtering by source/destination
Retrieve a single graph relationship

delete.description: Soft-delete a relationship (sets deleted_at timestamp)

patch.description: Update a relationship by creating a new version in the version chain

get.description: Retrieve all versions of a relationship ordered by creation time

post.description: Restore a soft-deleted relationship (clears deleted_at timestamp)
Combined full-text and vector similarity search with optional debug mode (requires graph:search:debug scope)

parameters.description: Search request with query and/or vector
parameters.name: request

parameters.description: Include debug timing and statistics (requires scope)
parameters.name: debug

post.description: Full-text search on objects with optional retrieval of connected neighbors
Perform breadth-first traversal from root nodes with depth and node limits

parameters.description: Root IDs and traversal options (max 50 roots)
parameters.name: request

200.description: Traversal results with visited nodes and paths

get.description: Get all configured integrations for the current project with optional filtering

post.description: Create a new integration configuration with encrypted settings

400.description: Invalid request or integration already exists

get.description: Get all available integration types that can be configured
Retrieve a specific integration configuration by name (includes decrypted settings with masked secrets)

put.description: Update an existing integration configuration (partial updates supported, settings will be re-encrypted if provided)

delete.description: Delete an integration configuration (permanent deletion)

get.description: Retrieve public (non-sensitive) integration information without decrypted settings

post.description: Manually trigger a synchronization job for an integration (integration must be enabled)
Test the connectivity and authentication for an integration (validates configured settings)
Sends an invitation email to a user to join a project with specified role (requires project admin access)
Accepts a pending invitation using the provided token, granting the user access to the project with specified role

get.description: Returns all pending (not yet accepted or declined) invitations sent to the current user's email address

200.description: List of pending invitations with project and organization details

delete.description: Revokes/cancels a pending invitation (requires project admin access). Revoked invitations cannot be accepted.

post.description: Declines a pending invitation, marking it as declined (user will not gain access to the project)
Legacy JSON-RPC endpoint for Model Context Protocol. Supports initialize, tools/*, resources/*, and prompts/* methods. Use unified /api/mcp endpoint for SSE support (Spec 2025-11-25).
post.summary: Execute Model Context Protocol JSON-RPC 2.0 requests

parameters.description: JSON-RPC 2.0 request (method: initialize, tools/list, tools/call, resources/list, resources/read, prompts/list, prompts/get)
parameters.name: request

get.description: Lists extraction jobs with filtering and pagination support
Retrieves full details including logs, LLM calls, and metrics for a specific extraction job
Retrieves LLM API call logs for a specific extraction job including tokens, cost, and duration
Retrieves system process logs for a specific extraction job with optional filtering by level
Returns filtered list of notifications for the current user with optional tab, category, unread, and search filters

parameters.description: Tab filter (all, important, other, snoozed, cleared)
parameters.name: tab

parameters.description: Search notifications by title or message
parameters.name: search

get.description: Returns notification counts grouped by tab (all, important, other, snoozed, cleared) for filtering purposes

post.description: Marks all unread notifications as read for the current user and returns the count of affected notifications

200.description: Confirmation with count of marked notifications

get.description: Returns aggregated statistics for the current user's notifications (unread count, dismissed count, total count)

delete.description: Dismisses a notification, hiding it from the notification list (marks as dismissed with timestamp)

patch.description: Marks a specific notification as read for the current user, updating read timestamp

get.description: Returns all organizations the authenticated user is a member of

post.description: Creates a new organization with the authenticated user as the initial member

get.description: Returns a single organization by its unique identifier

delete.description: Permanently deletes an organization by ID

get.description: Returns all projects the authenticated user is a member of. Supports filtering by organization and pagination.

post.description: Creates a new project with the authenticated user as the initial member

get.description: Returns a single project by its unique identifier

delete.description: Permanently deletes a project and all associated data

patch.description: Updates an existing project's properties (name, KB purpose, chat template, auto-extraction settings)

400.description: Invalid request body or project ID

get.description: Returns all users who are members of the specified project with their roles

delete.description: Removes a user from the specified project

400.description: Invalid project ID or user ID

get.description: Returns all invitations (pending, accepted, declined, revoked) for a specific project (requires project access)

200.description: List of invitations for the project

get.description: Returns all API tokens for a project (active and revoked). Token values are not returned.

post.description: Creates a new API token for a project. Returns the full token value only once at creation.

get.description: Returns a single API token by ID, including the full token value if encryption is configured.

200.description: Token details (includes full token value if available)

400.description: Invalid project ID or token ID

delete.description: Revokes an API token, making it permanently unusable

400.description: Invalid project ID or token ID

get.description: Returns paginated list of document parsing jobs with status, error details, and aggregate statistics. Supports filtering by status, project, and error state.
get.summary: List document parsing job queue (superadmin only)

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, processing, completed, failed)
parameters.name: status

200.description: Document parsing job list with stats and pagination

post.description: Deletes multiple document parsing jobs by ID.
post.summary: Bulk delete document parsing jobs (superadmin only)

post.description: Re-queues multiple failed/cancelled document parsing jobs for retry.
post.summary: Bulk retry document parsing jobs (superadmin only)

get.description: Returns paginated list of email jobs with status, delivery info, and error details. Supports filtering by status, recipient, and date range.

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, processing, sent, failed)
parameters.name: status

get.description: Returns email job details including subject, recipient, and template data (full HTML rendering not implemented).
get.summary: Preview email job template data (superadmin only)

get.description: Returns paginated list of embedding jobs (graph and chunk) with status, error details, and aggregate statistics. Supports filtering by status, project, and job type.

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, processing, completed, failed)
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter by job type (graph or chunk)
parameters.name: type

200.description: Embedding job list with stats and pagination

post.description: Removes embedding jobs that reference deleted objects or chunks (orphaned jobs).
Deletes multiple embedding jobs by ID. Supports both graph and chunk embedding jobs.

parameters.description: Job IDs to delete and optional job type (graph or chunk)
parameters.name: request

get.description: Returns paginated list of object extraction jobs with status, error details, and aggregate statistics. Supports filtering by status, job type, project, and error state.

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, processing, completed, failed)
parameters.name: status

200.description: Extraction job list with stats and pagination

post.description: Cancels multiple running/pending object extraction jobs by ID.
Deletes multiple object extraction jobs by ID.

get.description: Returns whether the authenticated user has superadmin privileges. Returns null if not superadmin, otherwise returns {isSuperadmin: true}.

200.description: Superadmin status (or null if not superadmin)

get.description: Returns paginated list of all organizations with member and project counts.

delete.description: Marks an organization as deleted (soft delete). Organization data is retained but org is deactivated.

get.description: Returns paginated list of all projects with org information and document counts. Supports org filtering.

delete.description: Marks a project as deleted (soft delete). Project data is retained but project is deactivated.

get.description: Returns paginated list of data source sync jobs with status, progress, error details, and aggregate statistics. Supports filtering by status, project, and error state.
get.summary: List data source sync job queue (superadmin only)

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, running, completed, failed)
parameters.name: status

200.description: Sync job list with stats and pagination

post.description: Cancels multiple running/pending data source sync jobs by ID.
post.summary: Bulk cancel data source sync jobs (superadmin only)

post.description: Deletes multiple data source sync jobs by ID.
post.summary: Bulk delete data source sync jobs (superadmin only)

get.description: Returns detailed logs and execution info for a specific data source sync job.
get.summary: Get data source sync job logs (superadmin only)

get.description: Returns paginated list of all users with their org memberships and email addresses. Supports search filtering and org filtering.

delete.description: Marks a user as deleted (soft delete). User data is retained but account is deactivated.

get.description: Returns paginated list of tasks for a specific project with optional filtering by status and type

parameters.description: Project ID (alternative to project_id query param)
parameters.name: X-Project-ID

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, accepted, rejected, cancelled)
parameters.name: status

get.description: Returns paginated list of tasks across all projects accessible to the current user with optional filtering by status and type

parameters.description: Filter by status (pending, accepted, rejected, cancelled)
parameters.name: status

get.description: Returns aggregated task counts by status (pending, accepted, rejected, cancelled) across all projects accessible to the current user
get.summary: Get task counts across all projects

get.description: Returns task counts grouped by status (pending, accepted, rejected, cancelled) for a specific project

parameters.description: Project ID (alternative to project_id query param)
parameters.name: X-Project-ID

get.description: Returns a specific task by its ID for a given project

parameters.description: Project ID (alternative to project_id query param)
parameters.name: X-Project-ID

post.description: Cancel a pending task (marks as cancelled, cannot be undone)

parameters.description: Project ID (alternative to project_id query param)
parameters.name: X-Project-ID

post.description: Mark a pending task as accepted or rejected with optional resolution notes

parameters.description: Project ID (alternative to project_id query param)
parameters.name: X-Project-ID

post.description: Creates a new template pack in the global registry with object type schemas, relationship schemas, and optional UI/extraction configs
Assigns a template pack to a project, making its types available for use

delete.description: Removes a template pack assignment from a project

patch.description: Updates a template pack assignment (e.g., toggle active status)

get.description: Returns template packs available for a project to install (not yet installed)
Returns compiled object and relationship type definitions for a project based on installed template packs
Returns template packs currently installed and assigned to a project
Returns a template pack by ID including all schemas and configs

delete.description: Deletes a template pack from the global registry. Fails if the pack is assigned to any projects.

400.description: Bad request (e.g., pack is assigned to projects)

get.description: Returns all object types registered for a project with optional filtering
Returns statistics about a project's type registry including counts and object distribution

post.description: Registers a new custom object type for a project with JSON schema, UI config, and extraction config

get.description: Returns a specific object type definition including incoming/outgoing relationships

put.description: Updates an existing type in the project type registry. Bumps schema_version when json_schema changes.

delete.description: Removes a type from the project type registry

get.description: Retrieves the user's recent activity across all resource types

delete.description: Deletes all recent activity records for the authenticated user

get.description: Retrieves the user's recent activity filtered by resource type

delete.description: Deletes a specific recent activity record by type and resource ID

post.description: Records a user activity event for recent items tracking

get.description: Returns the authenticated user's profile information

put.description: Updates the authenticated user's profile information (name, phone, etc.)

get.description: Searches for users by email query (partial match). Returns matching users excluding the authenticated user.

400.description: Missing or invalid email query parameter

get.description: Returns paginated list of backups for an organization with optional project filtering and cursor-based pagination

200.description: Paginated backup list with next cursor

get.description: Returns backup details including status, progress, size, statistics, and expiration info

delete.description: Permanently deletes a backup and its associated storage files. Cannot be undone.

get.description: Generates a pre-signed download URL (1 hour expiration) and redirects browser to download the backup ZIP file. Backup must have status 'ready'.

post.description: Initiates async backup creation for a project (includes documents, chunks, graph data, optionally deleted items and chat). Returns backup entity with status 'creating'. Poll GET /organizations/{orgId}/backups/{backupId} to track progress.

400.description: Invalid request or retention days out of range

post.description: Initiates async restore of a project from backup archive (coming in next phase)

501.description: Not implemented - coming in next phase

get.description: Returns restore job progress and status (coming in next phase)

501.description: Not implemented - coming in next phase

get.description: List all chunks for the project, optionally filtered by document ID

delete.description: Delete multiple chunks by IDs
Delete all chunks for a specific document
Delete all chunks for multiple documents
Delete a single chunk by ID

get.description: Returns the HTML coverage report index page (or helpful message if not generated)
Serves static files for coverage report (CSS, JS, etc.) with directory traversal protection

parameters.description: File path within coverage directory (use * for wildcard in actual route)
parameters.name: filepath

get.description: Returns debug information including memory stats and database pool stats (development only)
Returns all discovery jobs for a project

post.description: Initiates a discovery job to analyze documents and extract graph object types and relationships

get.description: Retrieves the current status, progress, and results of a discovery job

delete.description: Cancels a running discovery job

post.description: Creates or extends a template pack from discovered types and relationships

get.description: Returns the Swagger UI HTML page for browsing API documentation
Serves Swagger specification files (swagger.json, swagger.yaml)

parameters.description: File path (swagger.json or swagger.yaml) - use * for wildcard in actual route
parameters.name: filepath

get.description: Returns detailed health status including database connectivity and system uptime
Simple health check endpoint for Kubernetes liveness probes
Returns the generated OpenAPI/Swagger JSON spec (or minimal spec if not generated)
Returns readiness status based on database connectivity (for Kubernetes readiness probes)

post.description:
Search across graph objects, relationships, and document chunks with configurable fusion strategies
Supports multiple result types: graph nodes, relationship edges (triplets), and text chunks
Relationships are returned when embeddings are available and fusion strategy is RRF or weighted

parameters.description: If true, includes timing and statistics in response (requires search:debug scope)
parameters.name: debug

get.description: Returns all organizations and projects the user has access to with their respective roles

totalChars.description: Total chars across all doc chunks

chunks.description: Computed fields (populated via JOIN/subquery, not stored in documents table)

query_context.description: Optional query for relevance-based edge ordering during expansion

external_source.description: External source fields - columns removed from schema in Phase 5, kept for API compatibility

migration_archive.description: Migration archive - preserves dropped fields from schema migrations

org_id.description: Column removed in Phase 5, kept for API compatibility

revision_count.description: Computed fields (not stored, populated by queries)

external_source.description: External source fields for data sync

src.description: Populated by joins  src_id/dst_id store canonical_id values

inverse_relationship.description:
InverseRelationship is populated when an inverse relationship was auto-created
based on the template pack's inverseType declaration.

query_context.description: Optional: query text for relevance-based edge ordering during BFS

id.description: Can be string, number, or null

inverse_type.description: When set, creating this relationship auto-creates the inverse

source_types.description: For incoming: types this relationship can come from

target_types.description: For outgoing: types this relationship can connect to
